prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to secure CLI tools using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Securing CLI Tools using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates how to leverage FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance) web framework for building APIs, to secure command-line interface (CLI) tools written in Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI is not only for web APIs but can also be used to create secure CLI tools.
It offers features like input validation and error handling which are crucial for building secure applications.
FastAPI allows integrating third-party libraries such as Uvicorn and Hyperfast for running the server and handling HTTP requests respectively.
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to run FastAPI
Uvicorn (0.17.6) and Hyperfast (0.25) are the recommended versions for running FastAPI with Python 3.12
caveats: While FastAPI is a powerful tool, it may not be ideal for every CLI use-case due to its web-based nature.
Using FastAPI in a CLI context might involve additional steps or workarounds compared to traditional CLI tools.
